author: andschwa
body:
This resolves #532 and puts us at a known, good, soon-to-be-released version of .NET CLI.

**IMPORTANT**: you _must_ uninstall `dotnet-nightly` and install `dotnet`. If it doesn't work, refer to the readme to install a known version.

/cc @PowerShell/linux @palladia

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
@vors I tested, this also works on OS X :smile: 

However, I'm having trouble on my Windows 10 machine.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
Ha, PEBKAC. I forgot I'd originally installed CLI via the MSI, which put it further ahead in my path than the one I installed using their script. Works _just fine_ on `win10-x64`.

Going to see what I can do about the FullCLR framework as well. Ideally we shouldn't leave it as `dnx451`.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @PowerShell/linux Let's merge this now. Sign-offs please :smile:

title: Refactor projects for use with .NET CLI 1.0.0
